paragraphs: In August, India suspended the autonomy of the state of Kashmir and banned foreign journalists from entering. The New Yorker’s Dexter Filkins snuck in, in the company of the Indian journalist Rana Ayyub, who has documented the terrors of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s Hindu-nationalist party. Also this hour, Jamie Lee Curtis talks about horror, addiction, and Hollywood beauty standards. Plus, the chef of one of Los Angeles’s best restaurants on how to build a woman-friendly kitchen.
Rana Ayyub on India’s Crackdown on Muslims
Dexter Filkins talks to the embattled Indian journalist about Narendra Modi’s violent suppression of the country’s non-Hindus.
Jamie Lee Curtis, the Original Scream Queen
The star of “Halloween” scares easily and won’t watch a slasher film. But she’s bravely confronted real taboos: her history with addiction and the terror of Hollywood beauty standards.
The Chef Niki Nakayama Does It Her Way
The chef at one of Los Angeles’s best restaurants on how to build a woman-friendly kitchen.
